questions.text: All of the following drugs are therapeutic uses of penicillin, except :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Rickettsial infections

Highyeild:

Penicillin is effective in Bacterial meningitis Syphilis Anthrax Streptococcal infection Pneumococcal, gonococcal infection Leptospirosis Penicillin is not effective in Rickettsial infections

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A . Bacterial meningitis Clinical features In adults, the most common symptom of meningitis is a severe headache, occurring in almost 90% of cases of bacterial meningitis, followed by neck stiffness (the inability to flex the neck forward passively due to increased neck muscle tone and stiffness). Option: C . Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum subspecies pallidum. The signs and symptoms of syphilis vary depending on which of the four stages it presents (primary, secondary, latent, and tertiary). Option: D . Anthrax is an infection caused by the bacterium Bacillus anthracis. It can occur in four forms: skin, lungs, intestinal, and injection. Symptom onset occurs between one day and more than two months after the infection is contracted.

questions.text: Alternative medication for secondary prevention of acute rheumatic fever in penicillin-allergic patients is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Erythromycin Erythromycin is an antibiotic used for the treatment of a number of bacterial infections. This includes respiratory tract infections, skin infections, chlamydia infections, pelvic inflammatory disease, and syphilis.

Highyeild:

For secondary prophylaxis of acute rheumatic fever: Best drug: Benzathine penicillin G (1.2 million units, or 600,000 units if ≤ 27 kg) delivered every 4 weeks Frequent manifestations of penicillin allergy are—rash, itching, urticaria and fever. Wheezing, angioneurotic edema, serum sickness and exfoliative dermatitis are less common. Anaphylaxis is rare (1 to 4 per 10,000 patients), but may be fatal Penicillin-allergic patients can receive erythromycin (250 mg) twice daily.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is not used in typhoid?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Amikacin Amikacin is an antibiotic used to prevent or treat a wide variety of bacterial infections. These may include infections of the urinary tract, bones, and joints, lungs (eg. pneumonia), brain, blood, among others. It is also used in hospitalized patients to prevent infections.

Highyeild:

Amikacin achieves adequate killing in vitro but in vivo, concentrations are probably not sufficient for the killing of typhoid organisms so amikacin is not used in typhoid treatment

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B . Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and soft tissues and lungs (pneumonia). It prevents the bacterial cells from dividing and repairing, thereby killing them. Option: C . Cefepime is an antibiotic that fights bacteria. It is used to treat severe infections of the skin, lungs, stomach, urinary tract, and blood. It works by killing the bacteria that cause these problems. However, it will not treat a viral infection. Option: D . Azithromycin is an antibiotic used to treat various types of infections of the respiratory tract, ear, skin and eye in adults and children. It is also effective in typhoid fever and some sexually transmitted diseases like gonorrhoea.

questions.text: A 25year pregnant lady presented to medicine OPD with burning micturition and was diagnosed with UTI. Which of the following antimicrobials is preferred in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Amoxicillin + Clavulanic acid

Highyeild:

Most uncomplicated urinary tract infections are caused by Enterobacteriaceae, and E. coli is the most common species. Amino penicillins can be effective agents for urinary tract infections Amoxicillin + clavulanic acid is used in uti in pregnancy, as it is a safer antimicrobial in pregnancy Doxycycline, cotrimoxazole and ciprofloxacin are not used in pregnancy as they are teratogenic Note: The antimicrobials safer in pregnancy are: Penicillins, cephalosporins and macrolides

questions.text: A newly joined junior resident in paediatrics started a third-generation IV cephalosporin for gram-negative infection in a 15-day-old baby. The baby developed jaundice after that. Which of the following would be responsible for jaundice?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ceftriaxone Ceftriaxone is an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the brain, lungs, ear, urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, blood and heart. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery.

Highyeild:

Ceftriaxone has high albumin binding and displaces bilirubin from albumin binding sites, resulting in high bilirubin and jaundice in neonates. So a better alternative in neonates is cefotaxime which doesn't have this problem

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A . Cefotaxime is an antibiotic used to treat a number of bacterial infections in human s , other animals and plant tissue culture s . Specifically in humans, it is used to treat joint infections, pelvic inflammatory disease, meningitis, pneumonia, urinary tract infections, sepsis, gonorrhoea, and cellulitis. Option: C . Cefixime is an antibiotic medicine used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It is effective in infections of the respiratory tract (eg. pneumonia), urinary tract, ear, nasal sinus, throat, and some sexually transmitted diseases. Option: D . Cefoperazone is an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the lungs (eg. pneumonia), ear, urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, blood, and heart. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery.
